hints.content:
Let's use a place value chart to write $\goldD{20,000}+\tealD{4,000}+\maroonD{700}+\purpleD{60}+\greenD{5}$ in standard form.

Ten Thousands | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens |  Ones
:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:
$\goldD2$ | $\tealD4$ | $\maroonD{7}$ | $\purpleD6$ | $\greenD5$

Now, let's break our number into parts to write it in word form:
$\redD{24}{,}\blueD{765}$

$\redD{\text{Twenty-four thousand}}$ is to the left of the comma. 

 $\blueD{\text{Seven hundred sixty-five}}$ is to the right of the comma.

If we combine the parts, we write $24{,}765$ as twenty-four thousand, seven hundred sixty-five.

This is the completed chart:

Standard Form | Word Form | Expanded Form
- | - | -
$24{,}765$ | Twenty-four thousand, seven hundred sixty-five | ${20{,}000}+{4{,}000}+{700}+{60}+5$
